Solid 10cm foam thickness provides reliable fall protection
Efficient weight-to-area ratio (5.0kg for 1.1m²)
High impact protection rating
3-layer foam system for progressive impact absorption
cons:
Basic carry system — uncomfortable on approaches over 15 minutes
No shoe wipe — bring a towel
Minimal gear storage — you'll need a separate bag for shoes and chalk

pros:
Efficient weight-to-area ratio (1.8kg for 0.7m²)
Built-in shoe wipe keeps rubber clean between attempts
1000D shell fabric is seriously tough — resists tears and abrasion
Hinge fold creates a flat, even landing surface when open
Made with partial recycled materials
cons:
Only 3cm thick — limited protection on higher problems
No hinge protection — watch out for the fold gap on ground strikes
Basic carry system — uncomfortable on approaches over 15 minutes
Minimal gear storage — you'll need a separate bag for shoes and chalk

pros:
Innovative taco/zipper design creates seamless landing surface
Comfortable carry system with excellent weight distribution
Versatile couch mode for resting between attempts

Three-layer foam provides progressive impact absorption
cons:
Landing area slightly undersized compared to competitors at this price
Zipper mechanism adds complexity vs simple hinge designs
Premium price point for a medium-sized pad

pros:
Massive landing area inspires confidence on highball problems
Thick multi-layer foam absorbs big falls effectively
Premium build quality with reinforced shell
Excellent gear storage capacity
Taco fold eliminates hinge dead spots
cons:

Premium price makes it a significant investment
Overkill for lowball sessions
